Maybe you want to test this Eclipse 3.2.2 and XML related callisto features.
What can I do to cleanup my workspace?
It looks like you have an inconsistent installation. Try getting the latest Eclipse (3.3M6  20070323-1616) and the recently released Mylar 2.0M2.

(In reply to comment #6)
> It looks like you have an inconsistent installation. Try getting the latest
> Eclipse (3.3M6  20070323-1616) and the recently released Mylar 2.0M2. 
> 

I am using Eclipse 3.2.2 and Mylar 2.0M2. Why should I upgrade to Eclipse 3.3?

Actually, after deleting .mylar and importing the exported task list, the installation is working fine again.

Did you try the attached XML file?

The main cause of this error (failure while parsing interaction history) is now fixed in head. Let us know if the problem persists for you in 3.2.2 and we'll cut a build.  Fyi, this isn't related to the xml file in question but just in case, I tested it with both 3.3M6 and 3.2.2 without problems.

Thanks, Rob. When will the dev build for the E3.2.2 be available on the update site?

Cheers, J?rg

Joerg, do you still have a copy of the failing .mylar folder still available? It would be great to verify this fix against your interaction history (held in .mylar folder). I'm going to re-open until we verify this fix with either you or Tom.

My current .mylar folder still refuses to save the task list and displays that UI error. So I may use this one if you want me to verify this.

Should I update from the dev build update site?

J?rg

We'll have a build ready for you shortly...

Joerg: build 2.0.0.v20070403-1300 is now uploading to the following update site, and should be available in 30min.  Please let us know if it resolves your bug as we will likely push this build out as an update.

  http://download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev/e3.2
OK, I will be ready to update if it arrives.

OK, I did test the new development build.

First, I make a copy of the .mylar directory in the workspace.
Then I deactivated Mylar completely in another workspace, created a special
installation location for dev builds and download the new dev build.

Restarting and import a saved task list worked fine.

Now I switched to the workspace with the "bad" .mylar. This also worked fine.

Now I stopped Eclipse, moved the .mylar away and copied the saved "bad" .mylar.
Restarting worked also fine, error log is completely empty.

So I can report that this build works for me. Thanks for the fast response!

J?rg
Excellent, thanks very much for verifying this Joerg!  We'll release the fix as an update.
